title: Oscillations - speed of block on spring

content.description: A block on a horizontal surface is attached to one end of a horizontal spring. The other end of the spring is attached to a wall. The block oscillates with amplitude <math alttext="uppercase A" overflow="scroll"><mi>A</mi></math> and period <math alttext="uppercase T " overflow="scroll"><mi>T</mi></math>, as shown. There is negligible friction between the block and surface. At time <math alttext="lowercase t equals 0" overflow="scroll"> <mi>t</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>0</mn> </math> the net force on the block is zero.
content.question: Which of the following is an expression for the speed of the block at time <math alttext="lowercase t equals the fraction uppercase T over 6" overflow="scroll"> <mi>t</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mi>T</mi> <mn>6</mn> </mfrac> </math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="v equals , pi times uppercase A over uppercase T" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi><mi>A</mi></mrow><mi>T</mi></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="v equals the fraction with numerator 3 times the square root of 3, end root, times A, and denominator uppercase T" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><msqrt><mn>3</mn></msqrt><mi>A</mi></mrow><mi>T</mi></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="v equals the fraction with numerator pi times the square root of 3, end root, times A, and denominator uppercase T" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi><msqrt><mn>3</mn></msqrt><mi>A</mi></mrow><mi>T</mi></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="v equals the fraction with numerator 2 times pi squared times A, and denominator 3 times uppercase T" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><msup><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mi>A</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>T</mi></mrow></mfrac></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="v equals , pi times uppercase A over uppercase T" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi><mi>A</mi></mrow><mi>T</mi></mfrac></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
